basics.name: Ricki Ace Gaborno
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2025. I am striving to become a Software Engineer.

education.institution: Leeward Community College, Pearl City, HI
Pearl City High School, Pearl City, HI

highlights: Provided engaging tours and clear instructions for the golf course.
Maintain and monitored equipment to ensure safety.
Helped the manager with different tasks to keep things running smoothly.
Assisted in organizing and creating events.
Helped to make props for parades, plays, and assemblies.
Worked with teachers and fellow student council members to achieve shared goals.
Managed various games and food stands.
Ensured the safety of kids during events.
Set up and take down booths before and after each event.

awards.title: Manoa Opportunity Grant
awards.summary: Undergraduate students are awarded the Manoa Opportunity Grant if they: (1) Are a first time Bachelor’s degree seeker, and (2) Enrolled in at least 6 UH Mānoa credits applicable toward your degree.

awards.title: Dean's List, University of Hawai'i at Manoa
awards.summary: Undergraduate students are awarded the Dean's List distinction if they: (1) earn a semester grade point average of 3.5 or higher based on 12 credits or more taken for a grade (C/NC courses do not count), and (2) do not receive grades of W, I, F, or NC for that semester.

awards.title: Pearl City High School Valedictorian
awards.summary: This award was given to Pearl City High School Graduates with a cumulative GPA of 4.0 or higher.
